column5: Pike being the prime target with any of the following as additional species walleye, Lakers, brookies, small mouth, grayling. I have milage to fly to a major city in Canada and want to stay under 3500, less is fine as long as great fishing. Been to Great bear, Athabasca, Greta Slave, Ganglers, and 12 other places. Thanks Guys!
Lac La Marte Does not get any better.
pike50plus I sent you a pm

Last Mountain Lake in Saskatchewan, early in the season. Never been there but have seen it multiple times on TV. Looks like tremendous, world-class pike fishing. Giant walleyes there too. It's on my fishing bucket list.
Pike, Wherever you would go! : ) John
I replied to the pm's tonight

You are getting great suggestions here. The Yukon or Findland may help if you are looking for a world record pike!!! You have had a dozen trips of most folks lifetime. It's fun to try new places. I'm trying two new ones for me in NW Otario this season. Cedar up 105 Norrh of Vermilloin Bay and Mariom Lake just north of Atikokan. Both for smailies and eyeballs I hope. Whereever you go be safe and enjoy. It's too bad we don't live 1,000 years to fish 1% of where we'd like to. Jim
